result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin C. Breon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

If extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kevin C. Breon in court with attorney David J Susens.  Defendant Kevin C. Breon in custody.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties rec/rev revocation summary and are ready to proceed to sentencing today.  State makes statement re: recommended sentence.  Atty Susens responds and they are in agreement.  Requests this sentence run concurrent to sentence in 04CF132 from Richland Co.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Court advises DE re: felony firearms warnings, voting rights and appeal rights.  Parties will discuss possible credit and file a stipulation.  Court orders zero credit at this time and parties can submit any determined credit request in writing.

Ct 2:
3 years prison (1 year Initial Confinement and 2 years Extended Supervision)
Consecutive to Richland County case number 04CF132
Conditions of extended supervision:
All conditions from probation to continue as conditions of extended supervision
DE is not eligible for CIP or SAP
Any unpaid court obligations to be converted to civil judgments
Dodge Correctional
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 19, 2017 at 10:00 am.
re: reset
Dodge Correctional
Public Defender appointment
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 28, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Kevin C. Breon in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Rec'd copy of INFO/waived reading.     Court enters Not Guilty plea- Set for Trial.  Bond continues
Arraignment on May 24, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Kevin C. Breon in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin w/Dep. Brad Luber from SCSD.  State calls Dep. Brad Luber - SCSD - S&T.  Witness ID's DE.  Record to reflect ID.  Atty Tsai does cross-exam.  State does re-direct.  Witness excused.  State has nothing further but does closing argument.  Atty Tsai responds.  Court finds probable cause and binds over.  Bond continued.  Court notes previously filed bond modification requested has been settled.  Atty Tsai requests clarification re: no contact w/minors conditions as to his own family/relatives.  Court notes "no unsupervised contact".  State unprepared to address that today as he's covering this prelim for another attorney.  Court will adhere to bond as previously ordered, Atty Tsai would need to file additional motion to modify if they are still requesting it.  Arraignment scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
No poss controlled substance w/o valid Rx; not to have any unsupervised contact w/children under the age of 18

Defendant Kevin C. Breon by video from LEC with attorney Puck Tsai.  Defendant Kevin C. Breon in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State requests $500 cash bond.  Atty Tsai responds/believes DE will qualify.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $500.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Not to possess any controlled substances w/o valid prescription and not to have any unsupervised contact w/children under the age of 18.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Return date scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
